div.ab: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDER CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN. March 11, 1909. Thursday

figure.head: Four Ladies
figure.ab: There are four ladies in fancy appearing dresses. From left to right their dress color is: purple, red, blue, green. The lady in the red dress has a tall red head. The lady in the purple dress has red hair and a small purple hat. The other three have blonde hair.

div.p: Everybody dressed in their red for this is an Erie Tea They ear too much, talk too much - you can ?? They drink no the in me.

div.ab: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDER CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN. March 12, 1909. FRIDAY

figure.head: Molly on Snowshoes
figure.ab: A girl dressed in winter weather clothing is drawn on the left side of the paper. She is wearing two huge snowshoes. These snowshoes have red dots around the edges.

div.p: Molly on snowshoes that Mr. Weir got. Pretty picture is it not?!

div.ab: COPYRIGHT 1908, BY FRIENDSHIP CALENDER CO. NEW BRITAIN, CONN. March 17, 1909. Wednesday St. Patrick's Day
div.p: ST. Patrick was a usefuf saint he frightened all the snakes away - I wish he'd try his art on smoke around the Hammermill some day!

figure.head: Various Doodles
figure.ab: There are four clovers scattered around the page. Near the date there are two snakes. One is stretched out and the other is coiled. At the bottom of the page there is a sketch of the Hammermill factory.
